Enum.description: The output of COMPn is not routed to the COMPn I/O port

Enum.description: The synchronous output (including filtering) of COMPn is routed to the COMPn I/O port

Enum.name: INTERLEAVE
Enum.description: START event or software trigger will alternatingly start a conversion on ADC0 and ADC1

Enum.name: NO_EVT_OUTPUT
Enum.description: No event output when using the resynchronized or synchronous path

Enum.name: RISING_EDGE
Enum.description: Event detection only on the rising edge of the signal from the event generator when using the resynchronized or synchronous path

Enum.name: FALLING_EDGE
Enum.description: Event detection only on the falling edge of the signal from the event generator when using the resynchronized or synchronous path

Enum.name: BOTH_EDGES
Enum.description: Event detection on rising and falling edges of the signal from the event generator when using the resynchronized or synchronous path

BitField.name: GENCTRL0
BitField.description: Generic Clock Generator Control 0 Synchronization Busy bits

BitField.name: GENCTRL1
BitField.description: Generic Clock Generator Control 1 Synchronization Busy bits

BitField.name: GENCTRL2
BitField.description: Generic Clock Generator Control 2 Synchronization Busy bits

BitField.name: GENCTRL3
BitField.description: Generic Clock Generator Control 3 Synchronization Busy bits

BitField.name: GENCTRL4
BitField.description: Generic Clock Generator Control 4 Synchronization Busy bits

Enum.name: ER
Enum.description: Erase Row - Erases the row addressed by the ADDR register.

Enum.name: WP
Enum.description: Write Page - Writes the contents of the page buffer to the page addressed by the ADDR register.

Enum.name: PBC
Enum.description: Page Buffer Clear - Clears the page buffer.

Enum.name: WAKEONACCESS
Enum.description: NVM block enters low-power mode when entering sleep.NVM block exits low-power mode upon first access.

Enum.name: WAKEUPINSTANT
Enum.description: NVM block enters low-power mode when entering sleep.NVM block exits low-power mode when exiting sleep.

Enum.name: NO_MISS_PENALTY
Enum.description: The NVM Controller (cache system) does not insert wait states on a cache miss. Gives the best system performance.

Enum.name: LOW_POWER
Enum.description: Reduces power consumption of the cache system, but inserts a wait state each time there is a cache miss. This mode may not be relevant if CPU performance is required, as the application will be stalled and may lead to increase run time.

Enum.name: DETERMINISTIC
Enum.description: The cache system ensures that a cache hit or miss takes the same amount of time, determined by the number of programmed flash wait states. This mode can be used for real-time applications that require deterministic execution timings.

BitField.name: NSCHK
BitField.description: NS configuration change detected Interrupt Clear

BitField.description: NS configuration change detected Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: AOFFSET
BitField.description: NVM Address Offset In The Selected Array

BitField.description: Non-secure APB alias write enable, non-secure AHB writes to non-secure regions enable

BitField.name: WRITE
BitField.description: Reference value to be checked against NONSEC.WRITE

BitField.name: DRP
BitField.description: Data Remanence Prevention Ended Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: DRP
BitField.description: Data Remanence Prevention Ended Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: SEPARATE
BitField.description: Separate instruction and Data Memory MapsRegions

BitField.name: HFNMIENA
BitField.description: Enable Hard Fault and NMI handlers

BitField.name: PRIVDEFENA
BitField.description: Enables privileged software access to default memory map

BitField.name: REGION
BitField.description: Region referenced by RBAR and RASR

Register.name: MPU_RASR
Register.description: MPU Region Attribute and Size Register

Enum.name: VALUE_0
Enum.description: Counting down to 0 does not assert the SysTick exception request

Enum.name: VALUE_1
Enum.description: Counting down to 0 asserts the SysTick exception request

BitField.name: COUNTFLAG
BitField.description: Timer counted to 0 since last read of register

BitField.name: RELOAD
BitField.description: Value to load into the SysTick Current Value Register when the counter reaches 0

BitField.name: CURRENT
BitField.description: Current value at the time the register is accessed

BitField.name: TENMS
BitField.description: Reload value to use for 10ms timing

BitField.name: SKEW
BitField.description: TENMS is rounded from non-integer ratio

Enum.name: VALUE_1
Enum.description: 10ms calibration value is inexact, because of the clock frequency

Enum.name: VALUE_1
Enum.description: The reference clock is not provided

BitField.name: VECTACTIVE
BitField.description: Debug: Exception number of currently executing exception, or 0 if thread mode

BitField.name: VECTPENDING
BitField.description: Exception number of the highest priority pending enabled exception

BitField.name: ISRPREEMPT
BitField.description: Debug: Pending exception serviced on exit from debug halt

Enum.name: VALUE_1
Enum.description: Removes the pending state from the SysTick exception

Enum.name: VALUE_0
Enum.description: Write: no effect; read: SysTick exception is not pending

Enum.name: VALUE_1
Enum.description: Write: changes SysTick exception state to pending; read: SysTick exception is pending

Enum.name: VALUE_1
Enum.description: Removes the pending state from the PendSV exception

Enum.name: VALUE_0
Enum.description: Write: no effect; read: PendSV exception is not pending

Enum.name: VALUE_1
Enum.description: Write: changes PendSV exception state to pending; read: PendSV exception is pending

Enum.name: VALUE_0
Enum.description: Write: no effect; read: NMI exception is not pending

Enum.name: VALUE_1
Enum.description: Write: changes NMI exception state to pending; read: NMI exception is pending

Register.name: SystemControl_AIRCR
Register.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register

Enum.name: VALUE_1
Enum.description: Asserts a signal to the outer system that requests a reset

Enum.name: VALUE_0
Enum.description: O not sleep when returning to Thread mode

Enum.name: VALUE_1
Enum.description: Enter sleep, or deep sleep, on return from an ISR

BitField.name: SLEEPDEEP
BitField.description: Uses Deep Sleep as low power mode

Enum.name: VALUE_0
Enum.description: Only enabled interrupts or events can wakeup the processor, disabled interrupts are excluded

Enum.name: VALUE_1
Enum.description: Enabled events and all interrupts, including disabled interrupts, can wakeup the processor

BitField.name: UNALIGN_TRP
BitField.description: Unaligned accesses generates a Hard Fault

Enum.name: VALUE_0
Enum.description: Do not trap unaligned halfword and word accesses

Enum.name: VALUE_1
Enum.description: Trap unaligned halfword and word accesses

BitField.name: PRI_15
BitField.description: Priority of system handler 15, SysTick exception

Register.name: SystemControl_SHCSR
Register.description: System Handler Control and State Register

BitField.name: EXTEXCLALL
BitField.description: LDREX and STREX instructions always use the Global Exclusive Monitor

BitField.name: VECTPENDING
BitField.description: Indicates the exception number of the highest priority pending enabled exception

BitField.name: RETTOBASE
BitField.description: Indicates whether there are preempted active exceptions

Register.name: AIRCR
Register.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register

BitField.name: BFHFNMINS
BitField.description: BusFault and NMI are Non-secure and exceptions can target Non-secure HardFault

BitField.name: SLEEPDEEPS
BitField.description: The SLEEPDEEP bit behaves as RAZ/WI when accessed from the Non-secure state

BitField.name: SLEEPDEEP
BitField.description: Controls whether the processor uses sleep or deep sleep as its low power mode

BitField.name: SLEEPONEXIT
BitField.description: Indicates sleep-on-exit when returning from Handler mode to Thread mode

BitField.name: STKALIGN
BitField.description: Indicates stack alignment on exception entry

BitField.name: BFHFNMIGN
BitField.description: Enables handlers with priority -1 or-2 to ignore data BusFaults caused by load and store instructions

BitField.name: DIV_0_TRP
BitField.description: Enables faulting or halting when the processor executes an SDIVor UDIV instruction with a divisor of 0

BitField.name: USERSETMPEND
BitField.description: Enables unprivileged software access to the STIR

BitField.name: NONBASETHRDENA
BitField.description: Indicates how the processor enters Thread mode

Register.name: SHCSR
Register.description: System Handler Control and State Register

BitField.name: MMARVALID
BitField.description: MemManage Fault Address Register(MMFAR) valid flag

BitField.name: MLSPERR
BitField.description: Indicates a MemManage fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

BitField.name: MSTKERR
BitField.description: MemManage fault on stacking for exception entry

BitField.name: MUNSTKERR
BitField.description: MemManage fault on unstacking for a return from exception

BitField.name: LSPERR
BitField.description: Indicates a bus fault occurred during floating-point lazy state preservation

BitField.name: STKERR
BitField.description: BusFault on stacking for exception entry

BitField.name: UNSTKERR
BitField.description: BusFault on unstacking for a return from exception

BitField.name: INVPC
BitField.description: Invalid PC load UsageFault, causedby an invalid PC load by EXC_RETURN

BitField.name: FORCED
BitField.description: Indicates a forced hard fault, generated by escalation of a fault with configurable priority that cannot be handled, either because of priority or because it is disabled

BitField.name: VECTTBL
BitField.description: Indicates a BusFault on a vectortable read during exception processing

BitField.name: ADDRESS
BitField.description: When the MMARVALID bit of the MMFSR is set to 1, this field holds the address of the location that generated the MemManage fault

BitField.name: ADDRESS
BitField.description: When the BFARVALID bit of the BFSR is set to1, this field holds the address of the location that generated the BusFault

BitField.name: IMPDEF
BitField.description: Implementation defined, the bits map to the AUXFAULT input signals
